stream_context.summary: Kaze blocks-out and debugs several sub-areas of Course 14, talks through enemy behaviour, object parameters and retro-pipe placement, then launches a long brainstorming session to pick the Course 14 retro section concept (ultimately settling on a Mario Paint ‘draw-Mario’ mini-game) and to name the ice-castle level. He also tweaks object code, discusses memory-pack optimisation and outlines the remaining production schedule.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 geometry is largely UV-mapped; the area was enlarged to avoid camera problems and an unintended triple-jump skip was removed.
development_findings.quote: The area needed to be bigger for the sake of the camera… you can no longer do the triple jump thing here.

development_findings.summary: Current “grey” placeholder textures will be sent to Biobak for colour pass once block-out is approved.
development_findings.quote: This is what we're gonna send off to Biobak and he is gonna make the colors pretty and everything.

development_findings.summary: Instant warps will be added only after the full collision map exists; doing it earlier would waste time.
development_findings.quote: I’m not gonna make the area fully playable until the rework is done.

development_findings.summary: A new enemy, tentatively named ‘cut bump’, is being placed; Kaze is fixing its snap-back movement bug and evaluating its push-back strength.
development_findings.quote: What do you guys think of the bump? He’ll of course be a little more visible once the colors are in.

development_findings.summary: Spikes will be stylised as large pencil tips or crayons to fit the stationery theme and are being positioned in two main zones.
development_findings.quote: Ah, little crayon spikes… that could look nice, or pencil rather.

development_findings.summary: Older ROM hacks only required the Expansion Pak out of convenience; Kaze’s optimiser and proper memory management mean RTYI will run on stock hardware.
development_findings.quote: You could absolutely make Star Road work on the N64 without an expansion pack.

development_findings.summary: Exclamation boxes are ‘under-utilised’ and will be used more often; one will appear atop the pyramid to reveal the retro pipe/Yoshi coin path.
development_findings.quote: I kind of like exclamation boxes; we should be using them more across the whole game.

development_findings.summary: Retro pipe will now sit on the pyramid ledge; players see it early but need the Wing Cap or a rollable bridge to reach it.
development_findings.quote: I think the 8-bit pipe would be perfect on here. This is an easily visible location that’s kind of hard to get to.

development_findings.summary: The Course 14 retro section will be Mario Paint themed: a white canvas floor with colour pools where Mario ‘paints’ by walking. Players trace a dotted outline of Mario’s face; ground-pound fills areas and accuracy is scored algorithmically.
development_findings.quote: Outline of Mario and the sign on it says ‘Draw Mario’. When Mario walks he leaves this splotch trail on the floor… once it’s close enough you’ll get a star.

development_findings.summary: Detection will compare the player’s painted pixels against a 124×124 RGBA32 template; a threshold score grants the star.
Kaze adds a new saw-platform parameter: beepParam3 controls alpha/opacity, expanding object versatility.
development_findings.quote: We could easily do something like… opacity = beepParam3 & 0xFC; there you go, it's implemented.

development_findings.summary: Level-naming session ended with ‘Forgotten Fortress’ for the ice-castle level after chat brainstorming.
development_findings.quote: Alright, we're just going with Forgotten Fortress for now.

development_findings.summary: Project timeline: all main content targeted for 2025 completion, followed by extended polishing phase.
development_findings.quote: We’re definitely gonna finish all the main content in 2025 and then we have a lot of time to polish the game.

context_findings.summary: Kaze emigrated from Germany to Canada in 2021, citing frustration with German politics and corruption.
context_findings.quote: I moved to Canada because I needed to flee Germany. Germany fucking sucks.

context_findings.summary: He accepted a sponsored Roblox stream for $135, showing willingness to take small gigs to fund development.
context_findings.quote: That’s like almost $70 an hour to play Roblox, so… yes, I will absolutely be playing Roblox with you guys.

context_findings.summary: A pushy ISP installer swapped his home router without a signed contract; Kaze plans to revert after stream.
context_findings.quote: Now we have the router that, by their own admittance, is dogshit… after the stream we're just gonna set the internet back.

context_findings.summary: Expresses a design philosophy: hardware limits (stick aiming, memory) must steer design rather than be ignored.
context_findings.quote: When you make a game you need to be aware of the restrictions you have, and aiming with a stick fucking sucks.

biobak.summary: Will handle colour pass for the newly UV-mapped Course 14 area.
Kaze jokes Biobak ‘made him involuntarily learn French’ via Discord messages.
biobak.quote: You just made me involuntarily learn French.

zeina.summary: Responsible for outside section of the ice castle; that part is still pending.
zeina.quote: There’s still the outside area that Zeina wanted to work on.

zeina.summary: Lost internet because the new router was mis-installed; will fix after stream.
zeina.quote: You have no internet in your PC, the guy fucked it up. …Well, after the stream we're just gonna set the internet back.

key_stories.title: Choosing the retro section concept
key_stories.summary: Kaze struggled to adapt Mario Paint into a playable 3-D segment. After discarding Dr. Mario, Paper Mario and other ideas, he designed a ‘draw-Mario’ canvas minigame that fits both theme and mechanics.
key_stories.challenge: Mario Paint offers few obvious platforming hooks.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed alternative franchises and mechanics with chat, weighed pros/cons, then sketched a walking-paint system with colour pools and pixel scoring.
key_stories.outcome: Mario Paint concept locked; technical notes and pixel dimensions written for implementation.
key_stories.key_quote: Outline of Mario and the sign on it says ‘Draw Mario’… once we’ve drawn Mario close enough you’ll get a new star.

key_stories.title: Naming the ice-castle level
key_stories.summary: Course 11 lacked a title. Kaze and chat cycled through icy alliterations before settling on ‘Forgotten Fortress’, which evokes cold and mystery without clichéd ‘frost’ wording.
key_stories.challenge: Need a memorable, fitting name that avoids generic ‘Ice Castle’.
key_stories.process: Live word association, synonym searches, colour-emotion talk, and polling chat.
key_stories.key_quote: Forgotten as a word is like dark blue, transparent… especially when you put fortress behind it.

open_questions.context: Kaze outlined pixel-matching, colour pools and ground-pound fill but has not specified fill-algorithm details or performance impact.
